docs.text: did claus von bulow try to kill his wife sunny in their newport mansion ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that is the question reversal of fortune asks you to consider as it opens in a hospital ward , with a comatose sunny von bulow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is the main narrator of the film , in a narrative trick that was extraordinarily risky for schroeder .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dramatic trick works , as sunny von bulow narrates a compelling story of murder , sex , unhappiness , and a lawyer's moral dilemma as he takes a case he thinks he cannot win .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jeremy irons is claus von bulow , in what is his finest role , and one of the most devastingly evil performances in history .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is as hated as any man alive , as cold as a cucumber .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his remorse for his wife's comatose condition is nonexistant , and it is no wonder that even his children have difficulty accepting his version of what happened during christmas , 1980 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the background to the case is such .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during christmas of 1979 , sunny von bulow fell into a deep coma from which she recovered and awoke .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the same situation occured in 1980 , only sunny never woke , and probably never will .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when examined , it was found that she had 14 times the normal amount of insulin within her blood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: claus von bulow is then accused of attempted murder by his stepson , convicted , and freed on bail .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he immediately hires alan dershowitz , the renowed harvard law professor , to acquit him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ron silver is magnificent as a moral lawyer who cannot stand what has happened to him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we follow him through two very different cases ; the case of the johnson case , where two innocent kids are standing on death row for a crime they didn't commit , and von bulow , who he still hasn't figured out .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dershowitz doesn't know what happened to sunny , and he is extremely hesitant to take the case .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nevertheless , he does , based on certain things which happen during the investigative process that deeply upset him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: together with a group of law students , dershowitz concocts a defense and ultimately get the verdict reversed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: silver's performance is one of a handful of solid roles in this deep film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: schroeder directs on many different levels , with multiple plot lines which blend in wonderfully in the mind of alan dershowitz .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are flaws ; at times , the film gets overly theatrical .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet , due to glenn close's troubled and brutally honest performance as sunny von bulow , the use of her comatose body as a narrator works here fairly well .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the flashbacks are good , but at times schroeder doesn't fill in the blanks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie could have benefited with the increased attention of certain developments during the film , and it could have used a better ending .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film progressed wonderfully before ending suddenly , without any intelligent conclusion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the supporting characters are often neglected , and dershowitz's team should have been allowed to grow character wise , but schroeder over-simplifies the story and the characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet , for all these flaws , the film is deeply engrossing because of irons .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as von bulow , he is brutally evil .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: anti-semitic , prejudiced , arrogant , protective , he is a rotten , lying monster , whose conviction may have been wrong legally , but morally he was to blame .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: irons plays him to a cold perfection , with pathetic attempts to gain moral support for his claims to innocence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is an adulterous liar and a cheat who in all likelihood committed the murder .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , the genius of reversal of fortune comes in its distinction between moral culpability and legal responsibility .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is no doubt von bulow is responsible for his wife's death by years of neglect and coldness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , legally , did he do the murder ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: schroeder dares the viewer to make up his own mind .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with all the character flaws , reversal of fortune is an engrossing puzzle because it is intelligent ; he wants the viewer to make up his own mind .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: schroeder taunts the viewer with contradictory revelations , and then mentions that the answer to this compelling puzzle shall be revealed when we join sunny von bulow , in death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for all the failed dramatic theatrics , this is one that works beautifully .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we don't know what happened .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that sense of legal ambiguousness , along with von bulow's obvious moral guilt , is why reversalf fortune works .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the end , von bulow is as sadistic as ever .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: irons is haunting , and that is why reversal of fortune is so good .
docs.label: positive
